contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Former Municipality Japan |Name= Iwasaki |JapaneseName=岩崎村 |MapImage= Map.Iwasaki-Vill.Aomori.PNG |Since=March 31, 2005 |Currently=[[Fukaura, Aomori|Fukaura]] |Region=[[Tōhoku region]] |Prefecture=[[Aomori Prefecture|Aomori]] |District= [[Nishitsugaru District, Aomori|Nishitsugaru District]] |Area=173.58 |PopDate=February 1, 2005 |Population=2,655 |Density=15.3 |Tree= [[Maple]] |Flower= [[Adonis| Far East Amur adonis]] |Bird=[[Common House Martin]] |Coord= |CityHallLink= }} {{nihongo|'''Iwasaki'''|岩崎村|Iwasaki-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Nishitsugaru District, Aomori|Nishitsugaru District]] in western [[Aomori Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. Iwasaki Village was located in the southwestern corner of Aomori Prefecture, facing the [[Sea of Japan]]. The area was part of [[Hirosaki Domain]] during the [[Edo period]]. After the [[Meiji Restoration]], Iwasaki Village was created on April 1, 1889. On March 31, 2005 it was [[Merger and dissolution of municipalities of Japan|merged]] with the neighboring town of [[Fukaura, Aomori|Fukaura]], and thus no longer exists as an independent municipality. At the time of its merger, Iwasaki had an estimated [[population]] of 2,655 and a [[population density]] of 15.3 persons per km². The total area was 173.58 km². The village economy was dominated by commercial fishing and agriculture. The village was served [[Route 101 (Japan)]] highway, and by [[Mutsu-Sawabe Station]], [[Mutsu-Iwasaki Station]], [[Jūniko Station]], [[Matsukami Station]], [[Shirakamidaketozanguchi Station]] and [[Ōmagoshi Station]] on the [[Gonō Line]] of [[JR East]]. ==External links== * [http://www.town.fukaura.lg.jp/ Fukaura official website] {{ja icon}} {{coord|40|34|54.8 |N|139|55|35.5|E|region:JP_type:city_source:GNS-enwiki|display=title}} {{aomori-geo-stub}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Aomori Prefecture]]
